qas.question: Immigrants from latin America coming to North Carolina is increasing what?
What has happened to the number of Roman Catholics and Jews in North Carolina?
Religious diversity in North Carolina has generally what?
What is the second largest Protestant denomination in North Carolina?
What county in Piedmont is methodism especially strong in?

context: Currently, the rapid influx of northerners and immigrants from Latin America is steadily increasing <a0_0>ethnic and religious diversity<a0_0/>: the number of Roman Catholics and Jews in the state has <a1_0><a2_0>increased<a2_0/><a1_0/>, as well as general religious diversity. The second-largest Protestant denomination in North Carolina after Baptist traditions is <a3_0>Methodism<a3_0/>, which is strong in the northern Piedmont, especially in populous <a4_0>Guilford<a4_0/> County. There are also a substantial number of Quakers in Guilford County and northeastern North Carolina.
